snippet: As part of his audacious takeover proposal for Best Buy, Richard Schulze said that he would contribute about $1 billion of his holdings into a leveraged buyout offer. But an analyst at the Jefferies Group wondered why the company founder wasn't...
abstract: As part of his audacious takeover proposal for Best Buy, Richard Schulze said that he would contribute about $1 billion of his holdings into a leveraged buyout offer. But an analyst at the Jefferies Group wondered why the company founder wasn't rolling in more of his shares.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Jefferies Raises Questions About Schulze's Best Buy Holdings
